title: Help
headerDesc: Learn about PromptLint's key features and how to use them

hotkey.title: Global Hotkey
hotkey.description: Analyze prompts with a single shortcut from anywhere
howToUse: Select (drag) the text you want to analyze
Press {{shortcut}}
Selected text is analyzed automatically
tips: Shortcut can be changed in Settings (⌥⌘P, Hyper+L, etc.)
Some apps may require ⌘C copy after text selection

tray.title: System Tray
tray.description: Quick access to the app from the menu bar
howToUse: Look for the PromptLint icon in the menu bar
Click to open/close the analysis window
Right-click to show menu (Settings, Quit, etc.)
tips: Double-click to instantly analyze clipboard content
• indicator shows when a prompt is detected
App continues running in tray even when window is closed

clipboard.title: Clipboard Watch
clipboard.description: Automatically detect prompts in copied text
howToUse: Enable 'Clipboard Watch' in Settings
Copy any text - prompts are automatically detected
Tray icon shows notification when a prompt is found
tips: Automatically recognizes questions, commands, AI-related patterns
Sensitive info like passwords, API keys are auto-blocked
Press hotkey to analyze the detected prompt immediately

aibutton.title: AI Context Button
aibutton.description: Show analysis button when using AI apps
howToUse: Enable 'AI Context Popup' in Settings
Open ChatGPT, Claude, etc. - button appears at bottom right
Click button to instantly analyze clipboard content
tips: Button only shows while AI app is active
Useful if you don't remember the hotkey
Button expands when hovered

capture.title: Text Capture Mode
howToUse: Select capture mode in Settings:
• Auto: Try selection first, fall back to clipboard
• Selection: Use only selected text
• Clipboard: Use only copied content
tips: VS Code, Cursor, etc. automatically use clipboard mode
Some apps may require accessibility permission
If problems occur, use 'Clipboard' mode

variants.title: Prompt Improvements
howToUse: Check improvements at bottom of analysis results
Choose between Conservative/Balanced/Comprehensive
Use [Apply] button to apply directly to source app
tips: AI-powered improvements available with API key
Conservative: Minimal changes only
Balanced: Structured with GOLDEN checklist
Comprehensive: Full restructure for best quality

ide.title: IDE Project Detection
howToUse: Auto-detected when using VS Code, Cursor, JetBrains IDEs
Current project info shown at top of analysis window
Project-specific tips and pattern analysis provided
tips: Enable 'Project Detection Polling' in Settings
Session context is also used when using Claude Code
Shows tech stack, recent files, Git branch info

progress.title: Progress Tracking
progress.description: Track your prompt quality improvement over time
howToUse: Click 'View my progress' at bottom of analysis window
Check daily/weekly/monthly score trends
Identify frequently missed GOLDEN items
tips: Compare current analysis to your average score
Focus on improving weak dimensions (Goal, Output, etc.)
View grade distribution (A/B/C/D/F) at a glance

goldenExplain.title: What is GOLDEN Checklist?
goldenExplain.description: 6 quality indicators based on Anthropic's official prompt writing guidelines.

appCompat.title: App Compatibility
appCompat.explanation: Some apps (Cursor, VS Code, Terminal, etc.) don't support text selection capture due to AppleScript limitations. Select text, copy with ⌘C, then press shortcut.

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.step1Desc: Select text and press {{shortcut}}, or copy to clipboard first
quickStart.step2Desc: See your prompt score and improvement suggestions
quickStart.step3Desc: Copy or apply the improved version to your clipboard

golden.title: Understanding GOLDEN
golden.intro: GOLDEN is a framework for evaluating prompt quality across 6 dimensions:

goal.title: Goal
goal.desc: Is the objective clear? What do you want to achieve?
goal.detail: Clear goal setting is key. Instead of 'do this', write specifically like 'write code to do X for Y'.
goal.improvement: Specify your goal clearly. Including background on why this work is needed helps.

output.title: Output
output.short: What form of result you want
output.desc: Have you specified the expected format and structure?
output.detail: Clearly specify the desired output format. Tell whether you want code, explanation, list, table, etc.
output.improvement: Specify the format, language, and style of the result. e.g., 'Please write in TypeScript'

limits.title: Limits
limits.desc: Are there constraints like length, style, or scope?
limits.detail: Specify constraints to follow. Libraries to use/avoid, compatibility requirements, etc.
limits.improvement: Add constraints: version, performance requirements, restrictions, etc.

data.title: Data
data.desc: Have you provided necessary context and information?
data.detail: Provide background info, example data, current code state needed for the task.
data.improvement: Include relevant code, error logs, example data. More context is better.

evaluation.title: Evaluation
evaluation.detail: Provide criteria to judge if the result is successful. Test cases, performance goals, etc.
evaluation.improvement: Add success criteria: tests, performance goals, quality standards, etc.

next.title: Next
next.desc: Are follow-up steps or iterations specified?
next.detail: Share your plans after this task or overall context. AI can suggest more appropriate solutions.
next.improvement: Share the context of this work and next steps. You can get more suitable solution suggestions.

tray.title: System Tray
tray.description: PromptLint runs in your menu bar for quick access
tray.badge: Dot indicator shows when analysis is ready

capture.title: Text Capture Modes

auto.title: Auto (Default)
auto.desc: Tries selection first, falls back to clipboard

capture.note: Some apps (VS Code, Cursor, terminals) automatically use clipboard mode for compatibility.

ai.title: AI Enhancement
ai.intro: Connect an AI provider for enhanced analysis:
ai.setup: Go to Settings to add your API key

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Why doesn't text selection work in some apps?
faq.a1: Some apps block simulated keystrokes for security. Use clipboard mode instead.
faq.a2: Analysis is local. AI features only send prompts to your configured provider.
faq.q3: How do I change the shortcut?
faq.a3: Go to Settings and select a new shortcut from the dropdown.
